product_summary: Maige is an open-source infrastructure for running natural language workflows on your codebase. It allows you to automate tasks such as labeling, assigning, commenting, reviewing code, and even running simple code snippets. Maige is highly customizable and can be integrated with your existing GitHub workflow.
product_cons: May require some technical expertise to set up
Can be limited in terms of the types of tasks it can automate
May not be suitable for all types of projects
Can be slow to process large codebases
May not be able to handle complex or ambiguous natural language inputs

product_usecases.details: Maige can automatically label issues based on their title, description, and code changes. This can help to organize and track issues more effectively.
Maige can automatically assign issues to the appropriate team member or collaborator based on their expertise or workload.
Maige can automatically comment on issues and PRs with relevant information, such as documentation links, code snippets, or test results.
Maige can automatically review code for common errors and style violations. It can also provide suggestions for improvements.
Maige can automatically run simple code snippets to test or demonstrate functionality. This can be useful for automating repetitive tasks or providing quick feedback on code changes.

product_toolfor.details: Maige can help developers to automate repetitive tasks, improve code quality, and increase productivity.
Maige can help project managers to organize and track issues more effectively, and to ensure that code is reviewed and approved before it is merged into the main branch.
Maige can help QA engineers to automate testing and to identify potential defects early in the development process.
Maige is open-source and free to use, making it a great option for open source projects that need to automate tasks and improve code quality.
Maige can be used in educational institutions to teach students about code review, issue management, and automation.

product_pricing: Maige is free to use for the first 30 issues. After that, there is a Standard Plan for $30 per month. The Standard Plan includes unlimited issues, auto-labelling, auto-assignment, auto-comments, custom instructions, code review, and code generation.
